In order to determine the crystalline nature of as prepared AgNPs, the XRD spectrum was recorded. The observed results are summarized in Fig. 6A. The diffraction four peaks appearing at 2θ = 33.00 0, 45.30 0, 64.10 0, and 80.20 0 correspond to the (1 1 1), (2 0 0), (2 2 0), and (3 1 1); JCPDS = 04-0783) facets of the face centered cubic structure of silver. The Scherrer formula was used to determine the crystallite size (D) of AgNPs (Eq. (6))
(6)

k λ

where D = average crystallite size, k = constant equal to one, λ = wave length of X-ray source (0.1542 nm), β = angular line full width at half maximum intensity in radians and θ = Braggs angle. The mean crystallite size was found to be 14.2 nm to the width of (1 1 1) and (2 2 0) diffraction peaks nearly in close agreement with the NPs size calculated from TEM image.
